East Carolina University News Services announced today that the university will receive a  grant from the National Science Foundation NSF over the next three years to address gender inequality at ECU PERIOD

Since  Interim Chancellor Ron Mitchelson Associate Professor Stephanie George from the Department of Engineering Associate Professor Rachel Roper from the Brody School of Medicine Associate Professor Crystal Chambers from the College of Education Professor Kristen Myers from the Department of Sociology and other faculty members have contributed to the pursuit of funding from the NSF for the gender equality project PERIOD This money came from the NSF ADVANCE program PERIOD

The ECU project that addresses gender inequality is called THRIVE Towards Hiring Resources Inclusion Value and Excellence the release from ECU News Services said PERIOD It said THRIVE seeks to improve the universitys effort in the recruitment and retaining of women in faculty positions while focusing on STEM science technology engineering and math fields PERIOD

The NSF ADVANCE program that funded ECUs project is designed to foster gender equity through a focus on the identification and elimination of organizational barriers that impede the full participation and advancement of diverse faculty in academic institutions the release from ECU News Services said PERIOD

Myers said in the release ECU has made a ton of progress over the years PERIOD She said ECU is able to demonstrate that it is not dealing with a toxic and hostile climate that needs to be fixed because it has already laid the groundwork PERIOD

Advocates and Allies recognizes that the people who really have to change the structure are the people who are most privileged by the structure Myers said in the release PERIOD And typically in STEM fields that is full professors who are usually men PERIOD So they recruited these usually white men in positions of authority. other initiatives that ECU supports include BRIDGES which is a leadership academy for women the Chancellors Committee on the Status of Women the Dr PERIOD Jesse R PERIOD Peel LGBTQ Center efforts by the ECU Faculty Senate and the work of the Office of Equity and Diversity as evidence of ECUs commitment to diversity and inclusion according to the news release PERIOD

The grant from NSF ADVANCE will fund professional support for faculty and leadership provide resources of support to make sure women are allowed opportunities of leadership and establish accountability practices and incentives PERIOD
